message.entry: PatchSize is expected to be a two element or three element integer vector.
Specified indices into datastore must be in the range [1,NumObservations].
The number of dimensions specified in PatchSize cannot be greater than the number of dimensions in the image {0} of size {1}.
The number of dimensions specified in PatchSize cannot be greater than the number of dimensions in the pixel label image {0} of size {1}.
Patch size ({0}) must be smaller than image size ({1}) of the file {2}
The number of dimensions in the image, {0} cannot be less than the number of dimensions in the pixel label image {1}.
The input image {0} must have at least 3 dimensions.
No more data to read. Use reset method to reset to start of data. Use the hasdata method to check if data is available to read.
Unexpected input datastore. Only imageDatastore and datastores that are subclasses of matlab.io.datastore.MiniBatchable are allowed.
The output of read() on the input datastores must return images of the same size for input files {0} {1}
'MiniBatchesPerImage' name-value pair is ignored because the input datastore doesn't implement readByIndex() method.
The input datastore cannot be partitioned because it has not implemented matlab.io.datastore.Partitionable mixin.
DispatchInBackground name-value pair cannot be set to true when the input datastore has not implemented matlab.io.datastore.BackgroundDispatchable mixin.
DataAugmentation name-value pair cannot be set to an imageDataAugmenter object for 3-D patch sizes. Use transform method on the output of randomPatchExtractionDatastore to perform data augmentation.
DataAugmentation name-value pair cannot be set for these input datastores. Use transform method on the output of randomPatchExtractionDatastore to perform data augmentation.
The {0} method is not supported for these input datastores.
Input datastores must be of equal length.
Unsupported input datastores. The output of read() on ds1 and ds2 must contain one column each representing the training input and the desired network response respectively.
